ai.summary: A 7.3 km moderate hike around Lews Castle Park in the United Kingdom, featuring park paths and mixed terrain suitable for walkers and casual hikers.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed park terrain with well-maintained paths, some paved sections and compact gravel; occasional grassy areas and gentle elevation changes typical of a park route.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight; wear sturdy footwear and clothing appropriate for UK conditions; stay on marked paths, observe park rules; carry water and a phone; be mindful of other park users during popular times; if conditions are wet, expect slippery surfaces.
recommended_gear: Map or GPS device or smartphone with offline maps
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with especially pleasant conditions in spring and summer; plan for shorter daylight hours and potentially wetter conditions in autumn and winter.
